channel.title: Changing the colour of the loading bar?
channel.description:
Is this client sided using a colour code? if so which one? RGB?
Or is the loading bar apart of the sprites, i cant find it in there.

item.title: Changing the colour of the loading bar?
item.dc:creator: @V1LL3 V1LL3
item.description:
@V1LL3 wrote:

My sister downloaded a program called “color cop” it get the colour and the code from whenever your mouse is on the comp. This could be useful if you need the code.

Read full topic
item.source: Changing the colour of the loading bar?

item.title: Changing the colour of the loading bar?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

It’s Hexadecimal format. You could use a numerical format if you wanted. Like 0xFF0000 is RED, 0x00FF00 Green(or blue, can’t remember which), and 0x0000FF is either green or blue. can’t remember.

Read full topic
item.source: Changing the colour of the loading bar?

item.description:
@oldschoolscape wrote:

Thanks for the reply, do you know what 0xffffff is in, its not web colours or rgb :S[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 21, 2009, 09:50:37 am[/size][hr]Changing 0xffffff turns up errors, i dont think thats it.

item.source: Changing the colour of the loading bar?

item.title: Changing the colour of the loading bar?
item.dc:creator: @demonnd demonnd
item.description:
@demonnd wrote:

no i knew were the code was at one time but not any more i know its in the client.java search loading in there

EDIT:here is what i found in client . java i searched “loading” came up after third one

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method381(0xFFFFFF, "YOURSERVERHERE is loading, please wait...", 23693, c1 / 2 - 26 - byte1, c / 2);

i put the YOURSERVERHERE thing…lol
well the 0xFFFFFF
would be your color lol i usually just get the color code from paint (very noobish but works :p)
well there you go change the color as many times as you please.

Read full topic
